net.jbasics.util

Class Convert

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.jbasics.util.Convert

  • public final class Convert
extends Object

    Use these utility methods to convert one data type to another

     Why have yet another way to convert data types, when Java, Apache Commons, and other tools exist?

  Consider the following line of code:

    final int iVar = Convert.toInteger(someObject);

    1) It's simple. When you need to convert one data type to another, just write what you're thinking:
          "convert this value to an integer"

    2) Ease of reading. There's no doubt about what the above line of code is doing,
          so no one reading it will be left guessing.

    3) Checks for the possibility of losing information about the magnitude of a value,
          and throws an exception if that would happen. So your code won't accidentally attempt
          to convert the number 80,000 to a short with the value of 14,464.

    4) In general:
           Convert.toXyz(inputValue) throws exception if conversion fails
           Convert.toXyz(inputValue, defaultValue) returns defaultValue if conversion fails

    5) By default, if a conversion cannot be accomplished, then the method throws an exception.

    Dates and Times

        Date and time strings follow the ISO-8601 standard (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).
    The basic format is:
       yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.123456789timezone, where
          a) for dates, the entire "yyyy-mm-dd" is required
          b) for times, the 24-hour clock is used
          c) for times, the "hh:mm" is required
          d) the nano-second value can be anywhere from 1 to 9 digits
          e) timezone offset can be "Z", "+/-hh", or "+/-hh:mm"
    Some examples:
       2020-01-26
       2020-01-26T09:55
       2020-01-26T09:55:37
       2020-01-26T09:55:37.123456789
       2020-01-26T09:55:37.123456789Z
       2020-01-26T09:55:37.123456789-05:00
       2020-01-26T09:55:37-06:00
    All date and time objects use the new Java8 standards:
       LocalDate
       LocalTime
       LocalDateTime
       ZonedDateTime

    Narrowing conversion handling:

    • A narrowing conversion that would lose magnitude information always results in a run-time exception.
    • A narrowing conversion that would keep magnitude but lose precision does not throw an exception.
    • https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se8/html/jls-5.html#jls-5.1.3

    Bit numbering: (LSB 0) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bit_numbering

        bit #: 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0
    value: 1 0 0 1 0 1 1 0

    Byte numbering: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Endianness

        byte #:  3  2  1  0
    value:  7d f2 09 a3
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    2020-01-29
    Author:
    Rob Stoecklein

      • toIntegerNullIfBlankExOnErr

        public static Integer toIntegerNullIfBlankExOnErr(String inputValue)
        Convert the given inputValue String to an Integer with the following rules:
        • If the input is blank (null or only white-space characters), then null is returned
        • Leading and trailing whitespace characters are ignored
        • If an error occurs during conversion, an exception is thrown
        Parameters:
        inputValue - the value to convert
        Returns:
        converted value
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - -
        NumberFormatException - -
        Since:
        1.0

        Returns:

      • toLong

        public static long toLong(Object inputValue)
        Convert the given inputValue to a long, throwing an exception on any error. 
            Convert.toLong("936")   = 936 // numeric string
    Convert.toLong((byte)7) = 7   // byte
    Convert.toLong(8.4)     = 8   // double (rounds down)
    Convert.toLong(8.6)     = 9   // double (rounds up)
    Convert.toLong(true)    = 1   // boolean true
    Convert.toLong(false)   = 0   // boolean false
    Convert.toLong(null)                = 0   // null throws NullPointerException
    Convert.toLong("  ")                = 0   // blank string throws NumberFormatException
    Convert.toLong("abc")               = X   // bogus string throws NumberFormatException
    Convert.toLong((List)list)          = X   // invalid class throws NumberFormatException
    Convert.toLong(value > Long.MAX) = X   // out-of-range value throws ArithmeticException
        Parameters:
        inputValue - the value to convert
        Returns:
        converted value
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - if magnitude of converted inputValue would not fit into a long type
        NumberFormatException - if inputValue cannot be converted to long type
        Since:
        1.0

      • toStr

        public static String toStr(Object inputValue)
        Convert the given object to its string equivalent, defaulting to the empty string if input is null or empty list.

        Same as calling Convert.toStr(inputObject, "") 

            Convert.toStr(null)                  = ""
    Convert.toStr("  ")                  = "  "
    Convert.toStr("abc")                 = "abc"
    Convert.toStr(357)                   = "357"
    Convert.toStr(24.68)                 = "24.68"
    Convert.toStr((char)35)              = "#"
    Convert.toStr([empty List])          = "[]"
    Convert.toStr([empty Map])           = "{}"
    Convert.toStr([empty StringBuilder]) = ""
    Convert.toStr([empty StringBuffer])  = ""
    Convert.toStr(new byte[]{0x46, 0x28, 0x70} = "F(p"
    Convert.toStr(new byte[]{0x46, 0x28, 0x70} = "F(p"
        Parameters:
        inputValue - -
        Returns:
        value converted to String
        Since:
        1.0

      • toBigDecimal

        public static BigDecimal toBigDecimal(Object inputValue)
        Convert the given inputValue to a BigDecimal, throwing an exception on any error.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        converted value
        Since:
        1.0

      • toUnsignedInt

        public static int toUnsignedInt(byte unsignedByte)
        Converts the given unsigned byte to an integer. 
            Convert.toUnsignedInt(0x00) =   0
    Convert.toUnsignedInt(0x5B) =  91
    Convert.toUnsignedInt(0xA2) = 162
    Convert.toUnsignedInt(0xFF) = 255
        Parameters:
        unsignedByte - the value to convert
        Returns:
        the unsigned byte converted to an int
        Since:
        1.0

      • toUnsignedInt

        public static int toUnsignedInt(short unsignedShort)

    Convert.toUnsignedInt(0x43AB) = 17,323
    Convert.toUnsignedInt(0x9E15) = 40,469
    Convert.toUnsignedInt(0xFFFF) = 65,535
        Parameters:

      • toStringArray

        public static String[] toStringArray(List<String> list)
        Converts a List of Strings to an array of Strings. 
            Convert.toStringArray(null)            = [];    // null input
    Convert.toStringArray([])              = [];    // empty list
    Convert.toStringArray(["a", "b", "c"]) = ["a", "b", "c"];   // list
        Since:
        1.0

      • toList

        @SafeVarargs
public static <T> List<T> toList(T... array)
        Converts an array of type "T" to a List of type "T". 
            Convert.toList(null)            = [];
    Convert.toList("")              = [];
    Convert.toList([1, 2, 3])       = [1, 2, 3];
    Convert.toList([1.1, 2.2, 3.3]) = [1.1, 2.2, 3.3];
    Convert.toList(["abc", "xyz"])  = ["abc", "xyz"];
        Parameters:
        array - (either Object... or Object[])
        Since:
        1.0

      • stringToPrimitiveDoubleArray

        public static double[] stringToPrimitiveDoubleArray(String input)
        Converts a string of comma-delimited numbers into an array of doubles.
        Since:
        1.0

      • stringToPrimitiveDoubleArray

        public static double[] stringToPrimitiveDoubleArray(String input,
                                                    String separator)
        Converts a string of separator-delimited numbers into an array of doubles. 
            Convert.stringToPrimitiveDoubleArray(null, "@")                  = []                      // null
    Convert.stringToPrimitiveDoubleArray("", "$")                    = []                      // empty string
    Convert.stringToPrimitiveDoubleArray("12.3#45.6#78.9", "#")      = [12.3, 45.6, 78.9]      // standard list
    Convert.stringToPrimitiveDoubleArray(" 1.4 ^ 2.5 ^ ^ 3.6 ", "^") = [1.4, 2.5, 0, 3.6]      // extra spaces and missing item
        Since:
        1.0

      • toLocalDate

        public static LocalDate toLocalDate(String text)
        Convert the given string to a LocalDate, throwing an exception on any error.
        Parameters:
        text - date string formatted as "yyyy-mm-dd"
        Returns:
        converted value
        Throws:
        DateTimeParseException - if the text cannot be parsed
        IllegalArgumentException - if the text is null
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        LocalDate.parse(CharSequence)

        public static ZonedDateTime toZoneSameInstant(ZonedDateTime zonedDateTime,
                                              ZoneId zoneId)
        Convert the given instant in time to its equivalent, but in a different time zone.
        Parameters:
        zonedDateTime - the input date/time; it contains a time zone (required)
        zoneId - the time zone to convert the input to (required)
        Returns:

        DateTimeException - -
        IllegalArgumentException - -
        Since:
        1.0

      • toIso8601Str

        public static String toIso8601Str(LocalDate localDate)
        Convert the given localDate to ISO-8601 format "uuuu-MM-dd".
        Parameters:
        localDate - the date to convert
        Returns:
        ISO-8601 date format, or empty string if input is null
        Since:
        1.0

      • toIso8601Str

        public static String toIso8601Str(LocalTime localTime,
                                  boolean useFixedWidthFormat)
        Convert the given localTime to an ISO-8601 string.
        Parameters:
        localTime - the time to convert
        useFixedWidthFormat - flag to indicate use full string width (include trailing zeros)
        Returns:
        if localTime is null, return empty string if useFixedWidthFormat is true, to full ISO-8601 format "HH:mm:ss.SSS" if useFixedWidthFormat is false, to ISO-8601 format as specified in LocalTime.toString()
        Since:
        1.0

      • toIso8601Str

        public static String toIso8601Str(LocalDateTime localDateTime,
                                  boolean useFixedWidthFormat)
        Convert the given localDateTime to an ISO-8601 string.
        Parameters:
        localDateTime - the date-time to convert
        useFixedWidthFormat - flag to indicate use full string width (include trailing zeros)
        Returns:
        if localDateTime is null, return empty string if useFixedWidthFormat is true, to full ISO-8601 format "uuuu-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS" if useFixedWidthFormat is false, to ISO-8601 format as specified in LocalDateTime.toString()
        Since:
        1.0

      • toIso8601Str

        Convert the given zonedDateTime to an ISO-8601 string.
        Parameters:
        zonedDateTime - the time-zone-aware date-time to convert
        Returns:
        if zonedDateTime is null, return empty string
        Since:
        1.0

      • dateTimeToString

        public static String dateTimeToString(LocalDateTime localDateTime,
                                      DateTimeFormatter dateTimeFormatter)
        Format the given date-time using the passed DateTimeFormatter.
        Parameters:
        localDateTime - the date-time to format
        dateTimeFormatter - how to format the string; if null then use ISO-8601
        Returns:
        formatted date-time string
        See Also:
        DateTimeFormatter

      • dateTimeToString

        public static String dateTimeToString(LocalDateTime localDateTime,
                                      String formatString)
        Format the given date-time using the passed format string. 
            Convert.dateTimeToString(null, "MM/dd/yyyy HH:mm")       = ""
    Convert.dateTimeToString(date:2014-11-21T00:00, null)    = "2014-11-21T00:00"
    Convert.dateTimeToString(date:2014-11-21T08:15, null)    = "2014-11-21T08:15"
    Convert.dateTimeToString(date:2014-11-21T08:15:47, null) = "2014-11-21T08:15:47"
    Convert.dateTimeToString(date:2014-11-21T08:15:47, "MM/dd/yyyy hh:mm") = "11/21/2014 08:15"
        Parameters:
        localDateTime - the date-time to format
        formatString - how to format the string; if null then use ISO-8601
        Returns:
        formatted date-time string
        See Also:
        DateTimeFormatter

      • toStrFmt

        public static String toStrFmt(Object obj,
                              String format)
        Format the input data value using the given the format. 
            Convert.toStrFmt(null,  null)      = ""
    Convert.toStrFmt(4,     null)      = "4"
    Convert.toStrFmt(1.23,  null)      = "1.23"
    Convert.toStrFmt("hey", null)      = "hey"
    Convert.toStrFmt(17,    " 4d")     = "  17"
    Convert.toStrFmt(32,    "03d")     = "032"
    Convert.toStrFmt(122,   "04x")     = "007a"
    Convert.toStrFmt(1.23,  ".1f")     = "1.2"
    Convert.toStrFmt(78.9,  "e")       = "7.890000e+01"
    Convert.toStrFmt("hey", "s")       = "hey"
    Convert.toStrFmt(234,   "0X%1$2X") = "0XEA"      // includes "%1$" plus extra characters
    Convert.toStrFmt("hey", ".1f")     = ""          // bogus
        Since:
        1.0
